alert.note: Alert for Ketchikan Gateway Borough (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 24 at 9:42PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM AKST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...Ward Lake in the Southern Inner Channels. * WHEN...Until 300 PM AKST Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas near Ward Lake including trails, day use areas and campground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 938 PM AKST, trained weather spotters reported heavy rain in Areas near the Ward Lake recreational area. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly, especially near Ward Lake. Between 2.5 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible. - For Lake Connell Dam: Thursday at 8:00am the stage was 252 feet. Flood Stage is 252 feet. Impacts: At 251.0 feet: Water will begin to approach low lying areas of trails and picnic areas around Ward Lake. - Areas near the Ward Lake recreational area are the most likely places to experience minor flooding.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
